item.title: Acute Kidney Injury
item.description: Acute Kidney Injury Previously known as acute renal failure. Usually doesn’t occur in isolation Stages Stage Creatinine Urine Output 1 SCr increase >26 $\mu$mol/L within 48hr or SCr increase 1.

item.title: Chronic Kidney Disease
item.description: Chronic Kidney Disease Abnormalities of kidney function or structure present on at least 2 occasions >3 months apart. Unlikely to be reversible CKD replaces the term chronic renal failure.

item.title: Glomerulonephritis
item.description: Glomerulonephritis Immune system attacks glomeruli Causes/Factors Symptoms [[Nephrotic syndrome]] oedema hypoalbuminemia proteinuria >3.5g/day [[Nephritic syndrome]] [[Acute Kidney Injury]] haematuria present proteinuria (non-nephrotic) hypertension Post-streptococcal Vasculitis Signs Frothy urine Diagnostic Tests Urinalysis haematuria and/or proteinuria Immunological investigations Ultrasound Biopsy Management Complications/red Flags

item.title: Minimal Change Disease
item.description: Minimal Change Disease No change on histology under light microscopy Causes/Factors Child NSAID Symptoms [[Nephrotic syndrome]] normal eGFR Signs Diagnostic Tests Management Complications/red Flags

item.title: Nephritic Syndrome
item.description: Nephritic Syndrome Haematuria in nephritic proteinuria in [[Nephrotic syndrome]] Causes/Factors Symptoms Oedemia mild proteinuria haematuria hypertension renal failure Signs Diagnostic Tests Management Complications/red Flags

item.title: Nephrotic Syndrome
item.description: Nephrotic Syndrome Loss of protein in urine GBM has negative charge to repel proteins (Left) Loss of negative charge

item.title: Polycystic Kidney Disease
item.description: Polycystic Kidney Disease Polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) is an inherited condition that causes small fluid-filled sacs called cysts to develop in the kidneys.

item.title: Renal Cell Carcinoma
item.description: Renal Cell Carcinoma Cancer of the kidney that arises from the renal tubular epithelium Two most common: Clear cell (75%) Papillary (10%) Causes/Factors Age (60+)

item.title: Tubulointerstitial Nephritis
item.description: Tubulointerstitial Nephritis Type IV hypersensitivity reaction against tubules/interstitium IT IS NOT Acute tubular necrosis (ATN) - direct epithelial damage due to toxins/ischaemia

item.title: Wilms' Tumour
item.description: Wilms’ Tumour Cancer of the kidney that arises from nephroblasts (cells that develop into the kidney in embryological development) Causes/Factors Children < 5 y/o 5-10% genetic syndromes Beckwith-Weidemann Syndrome WAGR Syndrome Denys-Drash Syndrome (WT1 mutation) Clinical Features Local Primary Tumour Effects +++ Abdominal distention Haematuria 10% bilateral Effects of Distant Metastases Rare
